name: ABoVE -  Burn Severity, Fire Progression, and Field Data, NWT, Canada, 2015-2016
description: The fire progression map was made using an algorithm that enabled an assessment of wildfire progression rates at a daily time scale.
title: ABoVE: Burn Severity, Fire Progression, and Field Data, NWT, Canada, 2015-2016

name: ABoVE -  Landsat-derived Burn Scar dNBR across Alaska and Canada, 1985-2015
description: The differenced Normalized Burned Ratio (dNBR) was calculated for each burn scar from fires that occurred within the Arctic Boreal Vulnerability Experiment (ABoVE) Project domain in Alaska and Canada during 1985-2015.
title: ABoVE: Landsat-derived Burn Scar dNBR across Alaska and Canada, 1985-2015

name: ABoVE -  Wildfire Carbon Emissions at 30-m Resolution, Northwest Territories, CA, 2014
description: The focus of this study was to develop a high spatial resolution model to scale emissions from fires that occurred near Yellowknife, Northwest Territories, Canada, during 2014.
title: ABoVE: Wildfire Carbon Emissions and Burned Plot Characteristics, NWT, CA, 2014-2016

name: ABoVE -  Ignitions, burned area and emissions of fires in AK, YT, and NWT, 2001-2015
description: Burned area was retrieved from combining fire perimeter data from the Alaskan and Canadian Large Fire Databases with surface reflectance and active fire data from the Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS).
title: ABoVE: Ignitions, burned area and emissions of fires in AK, YT, and NWT, 2001-2015

name: Fire Intensity and Burn Severity Metrics for Circumpolar Boreal Forests, 2001-2013
description: Fire radiative power (FRP), a measure of the instantaneous release of combustion energy determined by fire line intensity and fire line length, was quantified using daily 1-km thermal anomalies/active fires of all quality during 2003-2013 and was used as a metric for fire intensity.
title: Fire Intensity and Burn Severity Metrics for Circumpolar Boreal Forests, 2001-2013

name: ABoVE -  Burn Severity, Fire Progression, Landcover and Field Data, NWT, Canada, 2014
description: The fire progression maps were made using an algorithm that enabled an assessment of wildfire progression rates at a daily time scale.
title: ABoVE: Burn Severity, Fire Progression, Landcover and Field Data, NWT, Canada, 2014

name: CMS -  Fire Weather Indices for Interior Alaska, 2001-2010
description: The NASA Carbon Monitoring System (CMS) is designed to make significant contributions in characterizing, quantifying, understanding, and predicting the evolution of global carbon sources and sinks through improved monitoring of carbon stocks and fluxes.
title: CMS: Fire Weather Indices for Interior Alaska, 2001-2010

name: Tree Mortality from Fires and Bark Beetles at 1-km Resolution, Western USA, 2003-2012
description: Tree mortality was estimated at 1-km spatial resolution by combining tree (AGC) and disturbance datasets derived largely from remote sensing. Tree mortality is expressed as the amount of AGC stored in trees killed by disturbance (Mg carbon per km2).
title: Tree Mortality from Fires and Bark Beetles at 1-km Resolution, Western USA, 2003-2012

name: Siberian Boreal Forest Aboveground Biomass and Fire Scar Maps, Russia, 1969-2007
description: The study area covered ~100,000 km2 of the Kolyma River Basin in northeastern Siberia in far northeastern Russia. Cajander larch is the only tree species in the study area and dominates the permafrost zone from the Lena River in Central Yakutia to the Sea of Okhotsk in the Far East (Krestov, 2003; Abaimov, 2010).
title: Siberian Boreal Forest Aboveground Biomass and Fire Scar Maps, Russia, 1969-2007

name: Fire Intensity and Burn Severity Metrics for Circumpolar Boreal Forests, 2001-2013
description: Fire radiative power (FRP), a measure of the instantaneous release of combustion energy determined by fire line intensity and fire line length, was quantified using daily 1-km thermal anomalies/active fires of all quality during 2003-2013 and was used as a metric for fire intensity.
title: Fire Intensity and Burn Severity Metrics for Circumpolar Boreal Forests, 2001-2013

name: LBA-ECO LC-39 MODIS Active Fire and Frequency Data for South America -  2000-2007
description: The analysis considered a high-confidence subset of all MODIS fire detections to reduce the influence of false fire detections over small forest clearings in Amazonia (Schroeder et al., 2008).
title: LBA-ECO LC-39 MODIS Active Fire and Frequency Data for South America: 2000-2007

name: Soil Moisture Data Shows What a Flash Drought Looks Like
description: NLDAS data in Giovanni depict decreasing soil moisture in the Mid-Atlantic States during autumn 2019
title: NLDAS VIC Land Surface Model L4 Monthly 0.125 x 0.125 degree V002 (NLDAS_VIC0125_M)

name: Satellite Observed Tropospheric NO2 Concentration Decreased over East Asia in early 2020
description: Pollution in Eastern Asia reduced as governments and citizens respond to the coronavirus pandemic
title: OMI/Aura NO2 Cloud-Screened Total and Tropospheric Column L3 Global Gridded 0.25 degree x 0.25 degree V3 (OMNO2d)

name: Cyclone Harold Tracks Through Idyllic Islands of the South Pacific
description: While much of the world‚ attention was focused on other pressing concerns, Severe Tropical Cyclone Harold was tracking through and near to some of the South Pacific‚ well-known vacation destinations, including the island groups of Vanuatu, Fiji, and Tonga.
title: GPM IMERG Early Precipitation L3 Half Hourly 0.1 degree x 0.1 degree V06 (GPM_3IMERGHHE)

name: Comparison of IMERG Early and Late Run Precipitation Data Products for Derecho Event of May 3, 2020
description: Shown here are two animations of the derecho, beginning prior to its formation in eastern Kansas and ending after the wake low passed through Nashville.
title: GPM IMERG Early Precipitation L3 Half Hourly 0.1 degree x 0.1 degree V06 (GPM_3IMERGHHE)

name: Precipitation Track of the Midwestern Derecho, August 10, 2020
description: Both this track‚ averaged over the period from 00:00 UTC on August 10 to 00:00 UTC on August 12 ‚along with half-hourly plots of the IMERG rainfall rate extracted from a Giovanni animation (Figure 2), indicate that the storms appear to have delivered somewhat more rain to parts of Illinois and Indiana
title: GPM IMERG Late Precipitation L3 Half Hourly 0.1 degree x 0.1 degree V06 (GPM_3IMERGHHL)

name: CROP Conditions Plot
description: The Crop Condition Plots bring together a variety of Earth Observation (EO) data products on the sub-national scale, each of which provides valuable insights on in-season crop development and current crop conditions.
title: Evaporative Stress Index

name: CROP Conditions Plot
description: The Crop Condition Plots bring together a variety of Earth Observation (EO) data products on the sub-national scale, each of which provides valuable insights on in-season crop development and current crop conditions.
title: NASA-USDA Global soil moisture, utilizing SMOS data

name: Global Forest Watch Map

title: MCD14DL

name: HEC-HMS
description: The Hydrologic Modeling System (HEC-HMS) is designed to simulate the complete hydrologic processes of dendritic watershed systems. The software includes many traditional hydrologic analysis procedures such as event infiltration, unit hydrographs, and hydrologic routing.

name: HEC-HMS
description: The Hydrologic Modeling System (HEC-HMS) is designed to simulate the complete hydrologic processes of dendritic watershed systems. The software includes many traditional hydrologic analysis procedures such as event infiltration, unit hydrographs, and hydrologic routing.
title: Shellfish Sanitation Water Quality Monitoring

name: Global Flood Monitoring
description: The GFMS is a NASA-funded experimental system using real-time TRMM Multi-satellite Precipitation Analysis (TMPA) and Global Precipitation Measurement (GPM) Integrated Multi-Satellite Retrievals for GPM (IMERG) precipitation information as input to a quasi-global (50¬∞N - 50¬∞S) hydrological runoff and routing model running on a 1/8th degree latitude/longitude grid.

name: ESSD - Global River Radar Altimetry Time Series (GRRATS) -  new river elevation earth science data records for the hydrologic community

name: NASA SMAP Level-4 Soil Moisture Product

title: Air Quality Atlas

name: NASA Product Gallery for the Krakatau Eruption April 2022
description: In response to the 4/11/2020 Krakatau eruption, the VIIRS sensor was used to measure the Sulfur Dioxide (SO2) that was put into the atmosphere by the eruption.
title: Global Fire Emissions Database, Version 4.1 (GFEDv4)

name: Spring 2020 Severe Storms
description: The NASA Disasters Program used optical satellite data to detect the path of tornadoes that occurred across the Southern US in March and April 2020.
title: CMS: Mangrove Forest Cover Extent and Change across Major River Deltas, 2000-2016

name: NASA Landslide Viewer
description: Landslide Viewer is a web portal to open global landslide data and environmental data from NASA, citizen scientists, and other resources. Knowing where and when landslides occur can help communities worldwide prepare for these disasters.
title: GPM IMERG Early Precipitation L3 1 day 0.1 degree x 0.1 degree V06 (GPM_3IMERGDE) at GES DISC

name: ARIA Damage Proxy Map (Copernicus Sentinel-1) of Vanuatu on 4/10/2020 for Cyclone Harold
description: The Advanced Rapid Imaging and Analysis (ARIA) team at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory and California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, California, in collaboration with the Earth Observatory of Singapore (EOS), created this Damage Proxy Map (DPM) depicting areas that are likely damaged caused by Cyclone Harold.
title: MISR Level 3 Cloud Top Height-Optical Depth Product covering a day V001

name: NASA Products for the Explosion in Lebanon August 2020
description: NASA's Advanced Rapid Imaging and Analysis (ARIA) team, in collaboration with the Earth Observatory of Singapore, used satellite-derived synthetic aperture radar data to map the likely extent of damage from an Aug. 4 explosion in Beirut.
title: EOS_ARIA-SG_202008_Lebanon_Explosion

name: ARIA Flood Proxy Map (Copernicus Sentinel-1) on 5/22/2020 for Cyclone Amphan
description: The Advanced Rapid Imaging and Analysis (ARIA) team at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory and California Institute of Technology in Pasadena, California, in collaboration with the Earth Observatory of Singapore (EOS), created this Flood Proxy Map (FPM).
title: EOS_ARIA-SG_202005_India_Bangladesh_Cyclone_Amphan

name: NASA Products for the Sulawesi Island, Indonesia Earthquake and Tsunami
description: The Advanced Rapid Imaging and Analysis (ARIA) team at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory in Pasadena, California, and Caltech, also in Pasadena, created this Damage Proxy Map (DPM) depicting areas in Central Sulawesi, Indonesia, including the city of Palu, that are likely damaged (shown by red and yellow pixels) as a result of the M7.5 September 28, 2018 earthquake.
title: EOS_ARIA-SG_202001_Indonesia_Floods

name: ARIA Flood Proxy Map (Copernicus Sentinel-1) on 1/2/2020 for the Indonesia Flooding
description: This is the first rapidly generated multi-temporal SAR-based flood map capturing flash floods in urban areas validated with ground observations.
title: EOS_ARIA-SG_202001_Indonesia_Floods

name: Cloud-top height data (MISR) for Tropical Storm Laura on August 24, 2020
description: The cloud-top height data can be used to examine the structure of Tropical Storm Laura. For example, the MISR cloud-top height data can highlight vortical hot towers, which are indicators of rapid intensification in the eyewalls of hurricanes.
title: MISR Level 3 Cloud Top Height-Optical Depth Product covering a day V001

name: River Watch
description: Satellite River Discharge and Reservoir Area Measurements
title: GPM GMI Brightness Temperatures L1B 1.5 hours 13 km V05 (GPM_1BGMI) at GES DISC
